result.execSummary:
The defendant Alexis Briann Stratton was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take >$500 - $5000), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
With credit for 147 days time served, STRAIGHT TIME. Huber release to be determined by HOC staff and Day Reporting Center. Defendant to Enroll with the Benedict Center. Court does not object to electronic monitoring.
- Provide a DNA  sample.

Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following within 1 year.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
All mandatory court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges (including DNA).

- Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he/she may never possess a firearm.
- Court advised defendant that he/she may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Alexis Briann Stratton

records.addlTxt: Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum to Plea and Elements/Jury Instructions, filed.

Defendant Alexis Briann Stratton in court, in custody.  Attorney William Anthony Rakestraw Ii in court for Alexis Briann Stratton.  Attorney Alexander James Geocaris in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for Plea and Sentencing Hearing. Parties have reached a resolution. State placed negotiations on the record. Defense counsel and defendant confirms. 

AS TO COUNT 1: Defendant was advised of constitution rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights and entered a plea of GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the guilty plea. Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his/her rights.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. 
Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession; Voting 

Sentencing hearing proceeded. Statements by State, Defense Counsel, and Defendant.

The Court ordered defendant to serve 12 MONTHS in the House of Correction, with credit for 147 days time served, STRAIGHT TIME. Huber release to be determined by HOC staff and Day Reporting Center. Defendant to Enroll with the Benedict Center. Court does not object to electronic monitoring.

- Provide a DNA  sample.

Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following within 1 year.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
All mandatory court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges (including DNA); 

20 day appeal rights given,
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he/she may never possess a firearm. 
Court advised defendant of his/her right to seek postconviction relief.
Court advised defendant that he/she may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.

Case in court for status conference.  Defense requeste plea and sentencing date.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 11.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 28, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Per Chief Judge Directive 22-04 effective July 30, 2022, this calendar will be assigned to Judge David Swanson, Branch 11 in Room 316 of the Safety Bldg.
